query: Define a function named factorial that takes an integer as input and returns an integer.
Define a recursive procedure to calculate the factorial of a number.
Use an if-else block to handle the base case (n == 0) and the recursive case of the factorial function.
Return the value 1 when n is 0 in the factorial function.
Return the product of n and the factorial of (n-1) in the recursive case of the factorial function.
Define the main function, the entry point of the program.
Declare an integer variable named num and initialize it to 5.
Declare an integer variable named result.
Call the factorial function with num as an argument and store the result in the result variable.
Use the printf function from the stdio.h library to print the result to the console.
Return 0 from the main function to indicate successful execution.
Include the standard input/output library (stdio.h) to use functions like printf.
